sentences.english: A charlatan murders without a knife.
She might be taken in by those quack doctors.
sentences.chinese: 她很可能会被那些庸医给骗了。

sentences.english: The quack was stormed with questions.
I ccouldn't believe a barber - surgeon like him would cure my tracheitis.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信这样一个庸医可以治好我的气管炎。

sentences.english: So-called "evidence-based medicine" has become modern-day quackery.
sentences.chinese: 所谓的循证医学已经成为当今的庸医骗术。

sentences.english: That quack doctor for the clap used to be stuck up in all the greenhouses.
sentences.chinese: 每一应公用厕所都有治淋病的庸医的招贴。

sentences.english: Quack, I eat how light hypnotic drugs is not the top at all?
sentences.chinese: 庸医，我吃的药怎么光催眠不顶事呢？

sentences.english: B:I never trust those stupid doctors.
George Bush : You mean that OLD KOOK , that CHARLATAN?
sentences.chinese: 你是说那个老怪物，那位庸医吗？

sentences.english: I never trust those stupid doctors.

definition: to have disregard for human life (idiom)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
to mislead the public with rumors (idiom)/to delude the people with lies
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
hospital scalper/sb who for a profit entices others to obtain medical care
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
